moves.1. e4:
Kewparknick 1345(my brother) vs. thehobbit  (1369)

plays e4 - Classical Chess Opening
moves.1... e5: A good reply (if you want to play a classical game)
moves.2. Nf3: best position for your knight to move
moves.2... Nc6: again the threat is met by a good defence
moves.3... Nf6: a good move - threatens the pawn on e4 as well as develops the king's side
moves.4. Ng5 Bc5: a strange move (or so it seems to white)
moves.5... Bxf2+: ? white is now thinking: yay a free bishop. how wrong can you get?
moves.7. Ke2: this tactic also works if th king moves to e3 or f3
moves.7... Qh4: ok, black is now really on the attack. white has to be careful
moves.8... Qf2+: a mistake from white (taking the rook) lead to a forced mate
moves.9. Kd3 Nb4+: a good move. white has only one option left...

opening: two knights defence (C57), Wilkes Barre (Traxler) variation
